Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer misinterpreted the CCDO in rejecting the applicant's immigration application
Application_Facts: The applicant performed intra-departmental coordination, which falls under the CCDO definition of 'Production Co-ordinator'
Decision_Outcome: Visa officer rejected the application based on alleged lack of experience as a 'Production Co-ordinator'
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the visa officer's decision
Court_Ruling: The court allowed the judicial review and ordered the case to be referred back for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Visa officer interpreted 'Production Co-ordinator' as requiring interdepartmental coordination, contrary to CCDO
Grounds_for_Claim: Misinterpretation of the Canadian Classification and Dictionary of Occupations (CCDO)
Legal_Standard: Correct interpretation of occupational descriptions in the CCDO by visa officers
Assessment_Factor: Nature of coordination duties (intra-departmental vs. interdepartmental) in the applicant's work experience
Applicable_Legislation: Canadian Classification and Dictionary of Occupations (CCDO)
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative decision-making process
Application_Basis: Eligibility under designated occupation per CCDO criteria
Governing_Rule: Visa officers must correctly interpret CCDO when assessing qualifications
Outcome: Judicial review allowed; matter remitted for reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Unlawful rejection of immigration application due to legal error
Cause_Description: Applicant's immigration application was rejected due to alleged ineligibility under the CCDO criteria
Legal_Provision_Violated: Improper application of CCDO occupational classification
Legal_Provision: Canadian Classification and Dictionary of Occupations (CCDO)
Evidence_Assessment: The applicantâ€™s experience met the CCDO standard for 'Production Co-ordinator'
Decision_Rationale: The visa officer erred in law by narrowly interpreting 'coordination' as only interdepartmental, contrary to the CCDO's inclusion of intra-departmental coordination
Decision_Making_Body: Visa office responsible for immigration application assessment
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard in administrative decision-making; correct interpretation of statutory instruments like CCDO
